intro: Cyrtandra carnosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, salmon-pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Cyrtandra carnosa is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is found in moist, shaded habitats.
